intro: Dichaetanthera echinulata, commonly known as the spiny thread-plant, is a flowering plant species native to South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. Its flowers are typically greenish or brownish, with prominent, spiny bracts that give it its common name. Dichaetanthera echinulata is often found in grasslands and open habitats, and it plays a role in local ecosystems as a source of forage for wildlife.
